mdRecord.dcterms:title: Surgical instruments set
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Contained in wooden case; owned by Dr. B.S. Middleton and Dr. B. Arthur Middleton, Emmerton, Richmond Co., VA. Set includes: 3 forceps, bone forceps, tweezers, bistoury with curved sharp point, bistoury with curved probe point, bistoury with sharp point, tenaculum, seton (?) needle, curette and director, 2 surgical needles in separate paper covers, 3 surgical needles wrapped together in one paper cover, surgical needle without cover, hook, 2 aneurysm needles, double hook, brush, spring lancet, paper scrap, capital saw, metacarpal saw, catling, amputating knife, amputating tenaculum.
Photographed by Claude Moore Health Sciences Library, Historical Collections and Services staff.
Owned by B.S. Middleton and B. Arthur Middleton [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: The University of Virginia Medical Artifacts Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: medical instruments or apparatus
